about.name: Berlin
about.info_text: Berlin, the capital of Germany, is a city steeped in history and known for its vibrant cultural scene. It is a city of contrasts, with a rich past that includes both the Prussian era and the division of the city during the Cold War. Today, Berlin is a bustling metropolis with a diverse population and a thriving arts and nightlife scene. Visitors can explore historic sites like the Brandenburg Gate, the Berlin Wall, and the Reichstag, or immerse themselves in the city's creative and culinary offerings. Whether you're interested in history, art, music, or contemporary culture, Berlin has something to offer everyone.

attractions_card.title: Brandenburg Gate
attractions_card.description: The Brandenburg Gate is one of Berlin's most iconic landmarks, a neoclassical arch that has played a significant role in German history.

attractions_card.title: Berlin Wall Memorial
attractions_card.description: The Berlin Wall Memorial preserves a section of the former wall, providing insight into the city's division during the Cold War.

attractions_card.title: Museum Island
attractions_card.description: Museum Island is home to several world-class museums, including the Pergamon Museum, Altes Museum, and Neues Museum.

attractions_card.title: Reichstag Building
attractions_card.description: The Reichstag is the German parliament building, known for its glass dome offering panoramic views of the city.

attractions_card.title: East Side Gallery
attractions_card.description: The East Side Gallery is a 1.3 km-long section of the Berlin Wall turned into an outdoor gallery featuring murals and graffiti art.

attractions_card.title: Alexanderplatz
attractions_card.description: Alexanderplatz is a central square with the iconic Fernsehturm (TV Tower), shopping, dining, and cultural attractions.

attractions_card.title: Holocaust Memorial
attractions_card.description: The Holocaust Memorial, or Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe, consists of a field of stelae and an information center.

attractions_card.title: Potsdamer Platz
attractions_card.description: Potsdamer Platz is a modern district with skyscrapers, entertainment, and cultural venues, representing Berlin's rebirth after reunification.

food_card.title: Currywurst
food_card.description: Currywurst is a beloved Berlin street food, featuring sliced sausages with curry ketchup and curry powder.

food_card.title: Schnitzel
food_card.description: Schnitzel is a traditional German dish, consisting of breaded and fried meat, typically served with potatoes or a salad.

food_card.title: Doner Kebab
food_card.description: Doner Kebab is a popular fast-food option in Berlin, with a variety of meats, vegetables, and sauces wrapped in flatbread.

food_card.title: Apfelstrudel
food_card.description: Apfelstrudel is a delightful dessert, with thin layers of pastry filled with spiced apples and often served with a scoop of ice cream.

food_card.title: Bockwurst
food_card.description: Bockwurst is a type of German sausage often enjoyed with mustard and a roll, making it a popular street food choice.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Adlon Kempinski
hotels_card.description: Hotel Adlon Kempinski is a luxurious and historic hotel located near the Brandenburg Gate, offering opulent accommodations and fine dining.

hotels_card.title: The Ritz-Carlton, Berlin
hotels_card.description: The Ritz-Carlton, Berlin is a five-star hotel known for its elegance, spacious rooms, and exceptional service.

hotels_card.title: 25hours Hotel Bikini Berlin
hotels_card.description: 25hours Hotel Bikini Berlin is a hip and modern hotel with a lively atmosphere and great views of the Berlin Zoo and city.

hotels_card.title: Motel One Berlin-Hauptbahnhof
hotels_card.description: Motel One Berlin-Hauptbahnhof is a stylish and affordable hotel located near the central train station, offering comfort and convenience.

hotels_card.title: Generator Berlin Mitte
hotels_card.description: Generator Berlin Mitte is a trendy hostel with private rooms and a vibrant bar, perfect for budget-conscious travelers.

transport_card.title: Berlin Tegel Airport
transport_card.description: Berlin Tegel Airport (TXL) is one of the city's airports, serving domestic and international flights.

transport_card.title: Berlin U-Bahn (Subway)
transport_card.description: The Berlin U-Bahn is an efficient subway system connecting various parts of the city, including major attractions.

transport_card.title: Trams and Buses
transport_card.description: Berlin's tram and bus network provides excellent coverage of the city and complements the subway system.

transport_card.title: Bike Rental
transport_card.description: Berlin is a bike-friendly city with numerous bike rental services, making it easy to explore on two wheels.
